biography: Rajiv Gandhi was an Indian politician and pilot who served as the prime minister of India from 1984 to 1989 for two terms. He took office after the assassination of his mother, then–prime minister Indira Gandhi, to become at the age of 40 the youngest Indian prime minister. He served until his defeat at the 1989 election, and then became Leader of the Opposition, Lok Sabha, resigning in December 1990, six months before his own assassination.
aiSummary: Rajiv Sarin is a radiation oncology - thyroid & cancer genomics specialist with an H-index of 110 at ACTREC (Faculty). Has been published in Nature, Nature Communications, The Lancet Oncology. Based in India.
